lexUnit.name: camped.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: be in camp at a location

sentence.text: Between 200 and 300 East Germans were yesterday camped in the mudbath which was once the majestic garden of the West German mission .
The work of documenting abuses , which had been begun by the CSJ , was continued and the association intervened on behalf of a group of travelling people who were camped on Belfast 's Shore Road .
When the children of Israel were camped in Moab near Jericho , many of them came to worship the local god , Bael-Poor , and there was some mixing with the Moabites .
Luckily for him , there was a troop of Boy Scouts camped nearby and they were able to get his car back on the road and Mr. Shaw on his way to York .
De Montfort 's men had to march up the northern scarp , but they still seem to have taken the royal forces , camped down in the priory grounds , by surprise .
He sighed regretfully as he picked his way slowly through the tattered refugees camped here and there on the floor , wondering what had become of his Louis XVI table .
All about us our fellow passengers were camped amidst their prodigious baggage .
Now imagine the scene with the soldiers camped on the banks of a big bend in a river .
Some of the army was camped outside the walls , but only a few sentries were stirring .
The Merkut clan was camped along the curve of a small lake , and when he saw the first yurts Burun kicked his st'lyan into a gallop , his spirit soaring with anticipation .
We were camped on ice and as usual my boots had frozen inside the tent .
The town was filled with disbanded soldiery from Menelik 's army , and on the hills outside were camped the armies of the various contenders for power .
We were camped fairly well up a valley that was completely enclosed by a magnificent pine forest .
They 're camped on common land which everybody has access to .
